issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Cannot build a default project to BlackBerry device or Simulator.
IP address is correct for device and simulator.

h5. Actual result
Failed in Studio and CLI

{code}
Info: Package created: /Users/oromero/Documents/Titanium_Studio_Workspace2/TIMOB-14690/build/blackberry/arm/o.le-v7/TIMOB-14690.bar
Error: Command failed: Error: Cannot connect: Connection to https://169.254.2.9:443 refused. Please check IP address settings for the target. You may have to reboot the target.
Error: Cannot connect: Connection to https://169.254.2.9:443 refused. Please check IP address settings for the target. You may have to reboot the target.

{code}
fields.summary: BlackBerry: Unable to build on to device or simulator
fields.environment:
Mac osx 10.9 Mavericks
Titanium Studio, build: 3.2.0.201311050151
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.0.v20131105094044
CLI 3.2.0
BlackBerry10 Device Simulator BB10_2_OX.1791
BlackBerry Z10 (10.1.0.2019)

comments.body:
Tested and verified the fix with:
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.2.0.201311161724
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.0.v20131117001643
BlackBerry Z10 (10.1.0.2019)
CLI 3.2.0-alpha

Was able to build the default app onto the device and simulator
